page.title: 16MEDIA.The Vigo Journal.
page.content: A form of the Vigo Journal was first produced some nineteen years ago.At first it was only a sheet of paper.After eight years it was transformed into a small magazine of about forty pages with news of Vigo Village at its best and at its worst.The first editor was Dr. Bill Thomas, who printed the booklet on a spirit duplicator in his garage.Since April 1985 Ian Wakefield has been editor. There was originally ten publications of the Journal a year,but because of a cutback in money there are now only eight produced.The cost of production is much higher than the money the Journal receives from its sales.Therefore,adverts are necessary to make up the difference.
